title: Did The Hobbit take place before LOTR? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, the Hobbit occurs in 2941 Third Age. Bilbo’s birthday party is 3001. Gandalf explains the Ring to Frodo in spring of 3018. They leave Rivendell at the end of that same year. Most of Lord of the Rings takes place in 3019 Third Age. The Third Age ends in 3021 around the time that Gandalf, Elrond, Bilbo, and Frodo leave for Valinor. Sam himself leaves for Valinor in Fourth Age 61. Aragorn dies in Fourth Age 120. Arwen dies in an unknown place in 121. A copy of the Red Book of West March (basically the Hobbit + Lord of the Rings) is copied down by the king’s historian in 172.

Yes, about 80 years before Frodo left the Shire. Aragorn was just a child while the events took place (which shows how stupid the movie was, for saying Aragorn was a Ranger in the North at the same time as the Battle of Five Armies).

Did The Hobbit take place before LOTR? Yes. If Bilbo had not found “his” ring (which turned out to be The One Ring), there would never have been a quest to destroy the Ring. In the real world, LOTR grew out of the public’s desire for a sequel to The Hobbit.

Yes. The events of The Hobbit take place in the Third Age year 2941. when Bilbo is 50 years old. The events of Lord of the Rings happen in 3001 (the birthday party) and 3018/3019 when Frodo leaves the Shire and the Fellowship is formed.

At the Beginning of LOTR Bilbo had the One ring. The Hobbit showed how he got the one ring. So the Hobbit came first. Well, actually no. The Silmarillion came first then The Hobbit then Lord of the Rings
The author rewrote the chapter “Riddles in the Dark” from The Hobbit, then he released it for general publication. After that, the author went on to write the trilogy.
